title: Mitchell, Walker-Peters receive first England call-ups
shortDescription: Crystal Palace's Tyrick Mitchell and Southampton's Kyle Walker-Peters have been called up to the England senior squad for the first time.

title: Rangnick's Man Utd role not clear | Poch, Ten Hag lead shortlist
shortDescription: Man Utd have still not internally outlined the nature of Ralf Rangnick's consultancy role, but Sky Sports News has been told it is "not envisaged to be very hands-on".

title: 'Ridiculous' to prevent Chelsea fans attending Wembley, says MP
shortDescription:
The government has been urged to allow Chelsea fans access to FA Cup semi-final
tickets, provided any proceeds go to the people of Ukraine.

title: Chelsea sale: 'Leading contenders from US'
shortDescription: Kaveh Solhekol explains the state of play with the sale of Chelsea and assesses  the merits of the various bidders.

title: Subscribe to the Sky Sports EFL Podcast
shortDescription: Listen to the latest episode and subscribe to the Sky Sports EFL Podcast from Sky Sports Football.

title: Dybala to leave Juve this summer as a free agent
shortDescription: Juventus forward Paulo Dybala is to leave the club this summer as a free agent after fresh talks failed to find a resolution over his future.

title: Beckham hands control of Instagram account to Ukrainian doctor
shortDescription: David Beckham handed his Instagram account - which has 71.6 million followers - to a doctor helping women give birth in the eastern Ukrainian city of Kharkiv.

title: Feeble cup exit leaves Everton fans pining for those hungry years
shortDescription: Sky Sports News reporter Alan Myers reflects on Everton's FA Cup defeat to Crystal Palace, which means 90 individual competitions without silverware.

title: World Cup play-offs: Portugal and Italy face crucial semi-finals
shortDescription: The World Cup 2022 play-offs take place over the next fortnight with the final three European berths yet to be decided ahead of this winter's tournament in Qatar.

title: Ref Watch: Should Jimenez have seen red?
shortDescription: Dermot Gallagher dissects the flashpoints from the weekend's action, including a second yellow card for Raul Jimenez after a clash with Illan Meslier.

title: Halkett and Stewart handed first Scotland call-ups; Marshall, McKenna drop out
shortDescription: Craig Halkett and Ross Stewart have been handed their first senior Scotland call-ups for March's double-header.

title: Did Jimenez deserve second yellow for Meslier clash?
shortDescription: Former Premier League referee Dermot Gallagher tells Ref Watch that Raul Jimenez was unlucky to receive a second yellow card and ultimately a red during Wolves' defeat to Leeds.

title: Will Bale be fit for Wales play-off vs Austria?
shortDescription: Wales are hopeful Gareth Bale will be fit for Thursday's World Cup play-off with Austria despite the Real Madrid forward missing the El Clasico defeat to Barcelona.

title: How good was Ronaldinho?
shortDescription: As Ronaldinho turns 42 years old, we assess his greatness at Barcelona in conversation with the former team-mate who rates him as the best ever.

title: Papers: Messi set for PSG stay amid Barca return reports
shortDescription: All the top stories and transfer rumours from Monday's national newspapers...

title: Euro: PSG pummelled by Monaco | Poch: A sporting shame
shortDescription: PSG  looked sluggish and apathetic as the Ligue 1 leaders slumped to a 3-0 defeat at Monaco, while Tammy Abraham scored twice in the Rome derby.

title: Gerrard: Saka will have to learn to toughen up
shortDescription: Steven Gerrard has warned Bukayo Saka he needs to toughen up after the Arsenal winger asked for more protection during the Gunners' victory over Aston Villa.

title: View from Spain after Clasico: 'A slap that hurts' | 'Black night for Real'
shortDescription: Real Madrid received a "slap to the face" in their quest for the Spanish title following a humiliating 4-0 home defeat to Barcelona - a "black night" for the club.

title: Barca thrash Real | Xavi: We could have scored even more
shortDescription: Barcelona took their resurgence under Xavi to another level by thrashing rivals and runaway La Liga leaders Real Madrid 4-0 in El Clasico.

title: FA Cup hits and misses: City slickers ruthless, Liverpool's fixture pile-up
shortDescription: Manchester City showed their ruthless side at Southampton as a slick finish to the game saw them through to a fourth consecutive FA Cup semi-final.
